section.name: jBpm Cartridge Modeling
section.p: The page describes the modeling standards one must follow to in order to use the jBpm Cartridge.

Most of the model elements will require a stereotype to be processed correctly, below you will find a table indicating on which model element you may put what stereotype, it will also denote which effect this has on the generation process.

tr.td: Putting this stereotype on an activity graph will tell the cartridge to generate code from it.
Designates an action state to be a jBpm task, this means all deferrable events will be calling assignment handlers.
Designates an event to be a jBpm after signal, this means it will be calling an action handler.
Designates an event to be a jBpm before signal, this means it will be calling an action handler.
Designates an event to be a jBpm node enter, this means it will be calling an action handler.
Designates an event to be a jBpm node leave, this means it will be calling an action handler.
By using one or more of these tagged values on a swimlane the cartridge will generate assignment expressions into the swimlane declaration in the beginning of the process definition XML descriptor.
